comments.author: Dennis
comments.body: Steve, This is THE classic "old timers" lunch ride. Enough distance, hills, and wind to make it a challenge. Can you break an hour??? I bet Cav can. Dennis

comments.author: Dave
comments.body: As a classic old-timer, I concur; this is a nice, soft ride in the country. My favorite part: the wind whistling through my dentures as I chuff away down Neva. Sort of a C-sharp minor. ZZZZCCCCSSSSFFFFFHHHH!!! See you guys Thursday.

comments.author: Terry
comments.body: cav rides?! ;-) terry P.S yo steve, thought thurs was gonna be mtn bike day? what happened to super walker? i see how you are... you roadies are all just one big clique aren't you?

comments.author: Steve
comments.body: If there's rain, I'm going to pass.

comments.author: Dave
comments.body: Rain? I laugh in the face of rain. No nancyboy, I! Actually, one of my post-op directives - the only one I'm following, in fact - requires that I keep the knee dry for a week. So I guess I'll beg off if it starts to drop buckets. Damn. BTW, got up 4-Mile yesterday, saw RL on the way back to the office. He was on his way to physical therapy. Hope they can salvage the ol' bloke; he's got real promise.

comments.author: Rob
comments.body: Hey all: Just got off the phone with Dave, and as I'm so terrified of rain, he suggested that we cancel the ride today so I don't have a phobia-induced heart attack while out riding. Furthermore, the folks in ETFS were calling me, saying something about me needing to deliver data projectors here, there, and everywhere, so I think I need to bag. In solidarity, Dave is bagging too. We'll try again tomorrow! Oh, and for what it's worth, the PT says I can start running UP hills. Anyone care to ride their bike UP flagstaff next week, and then run down? I'll be happy to escort your bike DOWN the hill for you :)

comments.author: Dave
comments.body: Here's a thought: Since I should still be taking the occassional rest/recovery day as a post-op consideration, I'd be happy to drive you back down Flagstaff one day next week. Let me know.

comments.author: Terry
comments.body: notice how the runners are the ones falling apart and needing physical therapy? ...oh well, guess that's what health insurance is for, eh? tb

comments.author: Rob
comments.body: Terry, you're so right. I should just stop running right now. I'll trade you a nice pair of running shoes for that swift bike of yours :) Meanwhile, I'm up for the ride tomorrow at lunch.

comments.author: Dave
comments.body: Nice ride guys! Too bad about the wind, but I figure we got a 15% better workout fighting the damn breeze... I'm wiped out. Imagine going UP Neva today!
